properties.areaDesc: Wyoming Black Hills; Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 1 at 2:27PM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A storm system will move through the central Rockies from late
Sunday through the early part of the week. Expect increasing
areas of snow Sunday night and Monday. Snow amounts in excess of 6
inches will be possible in portions of northeast Wyoming to the
higher Black Hills. At this time, the highest snow totals are
expected in southern Campbell County and the northern Black Hills.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10
inches possible.

* WHERE...In South Dakota, the Northern Black Hills and the
Central Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch means heavy snow, strong winds, freezing
precipitation, and cold temperatures are possible. Monitor NOAA
weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for
updates on this potentially dangerous storm.  Take time to
prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING
